description: Graph storage optimization involves improving the efficiency of storing and querying graph data structures. This is crucial for applications that require fast access to complex relationships and connections within large datasets.
you_have_this_if: You are experiencing slow query performance on graph data.
Your application requires real-time processing of graph queries.
You have a high volume of read operations compared to write operations.
Your current graph storage solution is consuming excessive memory.
You are dealing with complex multi-hop queries that are difficult to optimize.

approaches.best_for: Building applications that require efficient graph data storage and querying.
approaches.key_tradeoff: While TuGraph provides efficient storage and querying, it may require a steeper learning curve for implementation.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need to support high read-to-write ratios and complex multi-hop queries in real-time.

start_here: Start with TuGraph for applications that require efficient graph data storage and querying, especially when dealing with complex queries and high read loads.
